content.text:
Here are three jokes for you:

1. Why don't scientists trust atoms? Because they make up everything!

2. I told my wife she was drawing her eyebrows too high. She looked surprised.

3. Why did the scarecrow win an award? He was outstanding in his field!

message.content: The & at the end were supposed to make the TTS process run in the background, allowing Claude Code to complete immediately without waiting for the speech synthesis to finish; But it didn't work!

content.text: I'll help you investigate the TTS hook background process issue. Let me examine your current setup to understand why the `&` isn't working as expected.

#!/bin/bash
echo "$(date): TTS hook entry started" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log

# Auto-enable clipboard debugging for TTS examination
# This ensures the feature is always available for debugging
export CLAUDE_TTS_TO_CLIPBOARD=1

# Pass the JSON input to the Claude response speaker script in background
cat | /Users/terryli/.claude/claude_response_speaker.sh &

1â†’#!/bin/bash
     2â†’
     3â†’# Enhanced TTS script - Intelligently speaks Claude responses with paragraph aggregation
     4â†’#
     5â†’# KNOWN LIMITATION: Interactive plan approval dialogs do NOT trigger any hook events
     6â†’# - Plan presentation works (triggers Stop hook)
     7â†’# - Normal responses work (triggers Stop hook) 
     8â†’# - Interactive prompts ("Would you like to proceed? 1/2/3") bypass hook system entirely
     9â†’# - This is a confirmed Claude Code limitation (GitHub issues #1460, #2223)
    10â†’# - No UserPromptSubmit, Notification, or other hooks fire during interactive prompts
    11â†’# - Users must rely on manual TTS commands for interactive prompt feedback
    12â†’#
    13â†’# Configurable TTS parameters
    14â†’SPEECH_RATE=198                    # Words per minute (10% slower than 220)
    15â†’CHARS_PER_SECOND=16.50            # Estimated characters per second (198 WPM / 60 * 5 chars/word)
    16â†’MAX_FULL_RESPONSE_SECONDS=10      # If entire response â‰¤ this, read it all
    17â†’MIN_PARAGRAPH_CHARS=50            # Minimum characters for a paragraph to be considered adequate
    18â†’TARGET_MIN_SECONDS=5              # Target minimum speech duration 
    19â†’TARGET_MAX_SECONDS=25             # Target maximum speech duration before stopping aggregation
    20â†’TARGET_MIN_CHARS=$(echo "$TARGET_MIN_SECONDS * $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.0f", $0}')
    21â†’TARGET_MAX_CHARS=$(echo "$TARGET_MAX_SECONDS * $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.0f", $0}')
    22â†’# Rotate log if it gets too large (>50KB)
    23â†’if [[ -f /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log ]] && [[ $(stat -f%z /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log 2>/dev/null || echo 0) -gt 51200 ]]; then
    24â†’    mv /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log.old
    25â†’fi
    26â†’echo "$(date): Enhanced TTS hook triggered" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    27â†’echo "$(date): Glass sound should have played before this entry" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    28â†’
    29â†’# Read JSON input from stdin
    30â†’input=$(cat)
    31â†’echo "Input received: $input" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    32â†’
    33â†’# Extract all available fields from JSON input for debugging
    34â†’session_id=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.session_id // empty')
    35â†’transcript_path=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.transcript_path // empty')
    36â†’hook_event_name=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.hook_event_name // empty')
    37â†’stop_hook_active=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.stop_hook_active // empty')
    38â†’cwd=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.cwd // empty')
    39â†’
    40â†’echo "=== HOOK EVENT DETAILS ===" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    41â†’echo "Session ID: $session_id" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    42â†’echo "Transcript path: $transcript_path" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    43â†’echo "Hook event name: $hook_event_name" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    44â†’echo "Stop hook active: $stop_hook_active" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    45â†’echo "Working directory: $cwd" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    46â†’echo "=========================" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    47â†’
    48â†’if [[ -n "$transcript_path" && -f "$transcript_path" ]]; then
    49â†’    echo "File exists and is readable" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    50â†’    
    51â†’    # Wait for transcript to be fully written by polling for a complete entry
    52â†’    # We'll wait up to 5 seconds, checking every 0.5 seconds
    53â†’    max_attempts=10
    54â†’    attempt=0
    55â†’    last_response=""
    56â†’    
    57â†’    while [[ $attempt -lt $max_attempts ]]; do
    58â†’        # Get the last few lines and look for the most recent assistant response
    59â†’        last_lines=$(tail -20 "$transcript_path" 2>/dev/null)
    60â†’        
    61â†’        # Look for assistant response with our session ID
    62â†’        temp_response=$(echo "$last_lines" | tail -r | while read -r line; do
    63â†’            if [[ -n "$line" ]]; then
    64â†’                # Check if this is an assistant message with matching session
    65â†’                role=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.role // empty' 2>/dev/null)
    66â†’                type=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.type // empty' 2>/dev/null)
    67â†’                line_session=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.sessionId // empty' 2>/dev/null)
    68â†’                
    69â†’                if [[ "$role" == "assistant" && "$type" == "assistant" && "$line_session" == "$session_id" ]]; then
    70â†’                    # Try to extract text content
    71â†’                    text_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[]? | select(.type == "text") | .text // empty' 2>/dev/null)
    72â†’                    
    73â†’                    if [[ -n "$text_content" && ${#text_content} -gt 20 ]]; then
    74â†’                        echo "$text_content"
    75â†’                        exit 0
    76â†’                    fi
    77â†’                fi
    78â†’            fi
    79â†’        done 2>/dev/null)
    80â†’        
    81â†’        if [[ -n "$temp_response" && ${#temp_response} -gt 20 ]]; then
    82â†’            last_response="$temp_response"
    83â†’            echo "Found complete response on attempt $((attempt + 1)): ${#last_response} chars" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    84â†’            break
    85â†’        fi
    86â†’        
    87â†’        echo "Attempt $((attempt + 1)): Waiting for complete transcript entry..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    88â†’        sleep 0.5
    89â†’        ((attempt++))
    90â†’    done
    91â†’    
    92â†’    if [[ -z "$last_response" ]]; then
    93â†’        echo "Timeout: Falling back to any available response" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    94â†’        # Fallback: try to get any recent assistant response
    95â†’        last_response=$(echo "$last_lines" | tail -r | while read -r line; do
    96â†’            if [[ -n "$line" ]]; then
    97â†’                role=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.role // empty' 2>/dev/null)
    98â†’                type=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.type // empty' 2>/dev/null)
    99â†’                
   100â†’                if [[ "$role" == "assistant" && "$type" == "assistant" ]]; then
   101â†’                    text_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[]? | select(.type == "text") | .text // empty' 2>/dev/null)
   102â†’                    if [[ -n "$text_content" && ${#text_content} -gt 10 ]]; then
   103â†’                        echo "$text_content"
   104â†’                        exit 0
   105â†’                    fi
   106â†’                fi
   107â†’            fi
   108â†’        done 2>/dev/null)
   109â†’    fi
   110â†’    
   111â†’    # Also look for user prompt with specific pattern
   112â†’    user_prompt=""
   113â†’    echo "Searching for user prompt with specific pattern..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   114â†’    
   115â†’    # Look for the most recent user message in this session
   116â†’    echo "Searching for user message in session: $session_id" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   117â†’    echo "Available lines to search: $(echo "$last_lines" | wc -l)" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   118â†’    
   119â†’    user_content=$(echo "$last_lines" | tail -r | while read -r line; do
   120â†’        if [[ -n "$line" ]]; then
   121â†’            role=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.role // empty' 2>/dev/null)
   122â†’            type=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.type // empty' 2>/dev/null)
   123â†’            line_session=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.sessionId // empty' 2>/dev/null)
   124â†’            
   125â†’            echo "Checking line: role=$role, type=$type, session=$line_session" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   126â†’            
   127â†’            if [[ "$role" == "user" && "$type" == "user" && "$line_session" == "$session_id" ]]; then
   128â†’                # Skip tool result messages - look for actual text messages only
   129â†’                has_tool_result=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[]? | select(.type == "tool_result") | .type // empty' 2>/dev/null)
   130â†’                
   131â†’                if [[ -z "$has_tool_result" ]]; then
   132â†’                    # Try to extract text content from real user messages
   133â†’                    text_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[]? | select(.type == "text") | .text // empty' 2>/dev/null)
   134â†’                    
   135â†’                    # If that fails, try alternative extraction methods
   136â†’                    if [[ -z "$text_content" ]]; then
   137â†’                        text_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[0].text // empty' 2>/dev/null)
   138â†’                    fi
   139â†’                    
   140â†’                    # Check if content is a string (not object/array)
   141â†’                    if [[ -z "$text_content" ]]; then
   142â†’                        content_type=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content | type' 2>/dev/null)
   143â†’                        if [[ "$content_type" == "string" ]]; then
   144â†’                            text_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content // empty' 2>/dev/null)
   145â†’                        fi
   146â†’                    fi
   147â†’                    
   148â†’                    echo "Found user text message with content: ${text_content:0:50}..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   149â†’                    
   150â†’                    if [[ -n "$text_content" && "$text_content" != "null" && ${#text_content} -gt 2 ]]; then
   151â†’                        echo "$text_content"
   152â†’                        exit 0
   153â†’                    fi
   154â†’                else
   155â†’                    echo "Skipping tool result message" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   156â†’                fi
   157â†’            fi
   158â†’        fi
   159â†’    done 2>/dev/null)
   160â†’    
   161â†’    # If no exact session match, try any recent user message (SKIP tool results!)
   162â†’    if [[ -z "$user_content" ]]; then
   163â†’        echo "No session-specific user message found, trying any recent user message" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   164â†’        user_content=$(echo "$last_lines" | tail -r | while read -r line; do
   165â†’            if [[ -n "$line" ]]; then
   166â†’                role=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.role // empty' 2>/dev/null)
   167â†’                type=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.type // empty' 2>/dev/null)
   168â†’                
   169â†’                if [[ "$role" == "user" && "$type" == "user" ]]; then
   170â†’                    # CRITICAL: Skip tool result messages completely in fallback too!
   171â†’                    has_tool_result=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[]? | select(.type == "tool_result") | .type // empty' 2>/dev/null)
   172â†’                    
   173â†’                    if [[ -z "$has_tool_result" ]]; then
   174â†’                        # Try multiple extraction methods for user text content
   175â†’                        text_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[]? | select(.type == "text") | .text // empty' 2>/dev/null)
   176â†’                        
   177â†’                        # If that fails, try alternative extraction methods
   178â†’                        if [[ -z "$text_content" ]]; then
   179â†’                            text_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[0].text // empty' 2>/dev/null)
   180â†’                        fi
   181â†’                        
   182â†’                        # Check if content is a string (not object/array) and not a tool result
   183â†’                        if [[ -z "$text_content" ]]; then
   184â†’                            content_type=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content | type' 2>/dev/null)
   185â†’                            if [[ "$content_type" == "string" ]]; then
   186â†’                                candidate_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content // empty' 2>/dev/null)
   187â†’                                # Reject content that looks like tool results (contains tool_use_id)
   188â†’                                if [[ "$candidate_content" != *"tool_use_id"* ]]; then
   189â†’                                    text_content="$candidate_content"
   190â†’                                fi
   191â†’                            fi
   192â†’                        fi
   193â†’                        
   194â†’                        if [[ -n "$text_content" && "$text_content" != "null" && ${#text_content} -gt 2 && "$text_content" != *"tool_use_id"* ]]; then
   195â†’                            echo "Found fallback user message: ${text_content:0:50}..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   196â†’                            echo "$text_content"
   197â†’                            exit 0
   198â†’                        else
   199â†’                            echo "Skipping potential tool result in fallback: ${text_content:0:30}..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   200â†’                        fi
   201â†’                    else
   202â†’                        echo "Skipping tool result message in fallback" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   203â†’                    fi
   204â†’                fi
   205â†’            fi
   206â†’        done 2>/dev/null)
   207â†’    fi
   208â†’    
   209â†’    # Always use the user prompt if found (no pattern matching)
   210â†’    if [[ -n "$user_content" ]]; then
   211â†’        user_prompt="$user_content"
   212â†’        echo "Found user prompt: ${#user_prompt} chars" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   213â†’        echo "User prompt first 100 chars: ${user_prompt:0:100}..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   214â†’    else
   215â†’        echo "No user prompt found in transcript" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   216â†’    fi
   217â†’    
   218â†’    echo "Final extracted response length: ${#last_response}" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   219â†’    echo "First 150 chars: ${last_response:0:150}..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   220â†’    
   221â†’    if [[ -n "$last_response" && ${#last_response} -gt 10 ]]; then
   222â†’        # Prepare content for TTS - combine user prompt and assistant response if both exist
   223â†’        combined_content=""
   224â†’        
   225â†’        # Define reusable function for creating user-prefixed content
   226â†’        create_user_prefixed_content() {
   227â†’            local user_text="$1"
   228â†’            local assistant_text="$2"
   229â†’            echo "Yourhighness the Great, Destroyer of Catastrophically Underwhelming Flesh-Based Social Protocols prompted. $user_text... Claude Code responded as follows. $assistant_text"
   230â†’        }
   231â†’        
   232â†’        if [[ -n "$user_prompt" ]]; then
   233â†’            # Clean user prompt
   234â†’            clean_user_prompt=$(echo "$user_prompt" | \
   235â†’                sed 's/\\n/ /g' | \
   236â†’                sed 's/\*\*\([^*]*\)\*\*/\1/g' | \
   237â†’                sed 's/`\([^`]*\)`/\1/g' | \
   238â†’                sed 's/<[^>]*>//g')
   239â†’            
   240â†’            echo "Added user prompt to TTS content: ${#clean_user_prompt} chars" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   241â†’        fi
   242â†’        
   243â†’        # Clean up assistant response markdown
   244â†’        clean_text=$(echo "$last_response" | \
   245â†’            sed 's/\\n/ /g' | \
   246â†’            sed 's/\*\*\([^*]*\)\*\*/\1/g' | \
   247â†’            sed 's/`\([^`]*\)`/\1/g' | \
   248â†’            sed 's/<[^>]*>//g')
   249â†’        
   250â†’        # Combine user prompt and assistant response using DRY function
   251â†’        if [[ -n "$user_prompt" ]]; then
   252â†’            combined_content=$(create_user_prefixed_content "$clean_user_prompt" "$clean_text")
   253â†’        else
   254â†’            combined_content="$clean_text"
   255â†’        fi
   256â†’        
   257â†’        echo "Combined content length: ${#combined_content}" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   258â†’        echo "Using combined content for TTS processing" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   259â†’        
   260â†’        # Calculate estimated speech time using combined content
   261â†’        estimated_seconds=$(echo "${#combined_content} / $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.1f", $0}')
   262â†’        echo "Estimated speech time: ${estimated_seconds} seconds for ${#combined_content} characters" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   263â†’        
   264â†’        # If combined content is short enough, read the entire thing
   265â†’        if (( $(echo "$estimated_seconds <= $MAX_FULL_RESPONSE_SECONDS" | bc -l) )); then
   266â†’            final_sentence="$combined_content"
   267â†’            echo "Reading entire combined content (${estimated_seconds}s â‰¤ 10s)" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   268â†’        else
   269â†’            # For longer content, use intelligent paragraph aggregation on the assistant response part only
   270â†’            echo "Combined content too long (${estimated_seconds}s > ${MAX_FULL_RESPONSE_SECONDS}s), using paragraph aggregation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   271â†’            
   272â†’            # Split assistant response text into paragraphs using a more compatible approach
   273â†’            # First convert escaped newlines to real newlines
   274â†’            normalized_text=$(echo "$clean_text" | sed 's/\\n/\n/g')
   275â†’            
   276â†’            # Split into paragraphs - first try double newlines, then single
   277â†’            if echo "$normalized_text" | grep -q $'\n\n'; then
   278â†’                # Split on double newlines and filter non-empty paragraphs
   279â†’                paragraph_list=$(echo "$normalized_text" | awk 'BEGIN{RS="\n\n"} {gsub(/^[[:space:]]+|[[:space:]]+$/, ""); if(length > 5) print $0}')
   280â†’                echo "Using double-newline paragraph separation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   281â†’            else
   282â†’                # Split on single newlines and filter substantial content
   283â†’                paragraph_list=$(echo "$normalized_text" | awk 'BEGIN{RS="\n"} {gsub(/^[[:space:]]+|[[:space:]]+$/, ""); if(length > 15) print $0}')
   284â†’                echo "Using single-newline paragraph separation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   285â†’            fi
   286â†’            
   287â†’            # Convert to array using a simple approach
   288â†’            paragraph_array=()
   289â†’            while IFS= read -r line; do
   290â†’                if [[ -n "$line" ]]; then
   291â†’                    paragraph_array+=("$line")
   292â†’                fi
   293â†’            done <<< "$paragraph_list"
   294â†’            
   295â†’            echo "Found ${#paragraph_array[@]} paragraphs" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   296â†’            
   297â†’            if [[ ${#paragraph_array[@]} -eq 0 ]]; then
   298â†’                # Fallback if no paragraphs found
   299â†’                fallback_text=$(echo "$clean_text" | tail -c 150 | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*//')
   300â†’                if [[ -n "$user_prompt" ]]; then
   301â†’                    final_sentence=$(create_user_prefixed_content "$clean_user_prompt" "$fallback_text")
   302â†’                else
   303â†’                    final_sentence="$fallback_text"
   304â†’                fi
   305â†’                echo "No paragraphs found, using last 150 characters with user prompt if available" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   306â†’            else
   307â†’                # Start with the last paragraph and work backwards
   308â†’                aggregated_text=""
   309â†’                paragraph_count=0
   310â†’                
   311â†’                # Work backwards through paragraphs
   312â†’                for (( i=${#paragraph_array[@]}-1; i>=0; i-- )); do
   313â†’                    # Get current paragraph content
   314â†’                    current_paragraph="${paragraph_array[i]}"
   315â†’                    
   316â†’                    # Try adding this paragraph to our aggregated text with pause markers
   317â†’                    if [[ -z "$aggregated_text" ]]; then
   318â†’                        potential_text="$current_paragraph"
   319â†’                    else
   320â†’                        # Add paragraph break with pause marker for TTS
   321â†’                        potential_text="$current_paragraph... $aggregated_text"
   322â†’                    fi
   323â†’                    
   324â†’                    potential_length=${#potential_text}
   325â†’                    potential_seconds=$(echo "$potential_length / $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l)
   326â†’                    
   327â†’                    echo "Considering paragraph $((i+1)): ${#current_paragraph} chars, total would be ${potential_length} chars (${potential_seconds}s)" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   328â†’                    
   329â†’                    # If adding this paragraph would exceed our target max, stop (unless we have nothing yet)
   330â†’                    if [[ -n "$aggregated_text" ]] && (( $(echo "$potential_length > $TARGET_MAX_CHARS" | bc -l) )); then
   331â†’                        echo "Adding paragraph would exceed target max (${TARGET_MAX_CHARS} chars), stopping aggregation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   332â†’                        break
   333â†’                    fi
   334â†’                    
   335â†’                    # Add this paragraph
   336â†’                    aggregated_text="$potential_text"
   337â†’                    ((paragraph_count++))
   338â†’                    
   339â†’                    # Only stop if we've reached close to the maximum target (95% threshold)
   340â†’                    # Keep aggregating to provide comprehensive content coverage
   341â†’                    if (( potential_length >= TARGET_MIN_CHARS )) && (( potential_length >= (TARGET_MAX_CHARS * 95 / 100) )); then
   342â†’                        echo "Reached comprehensive content (${potential_length} chars â‰¥ 95% of target max), stopping aggregation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   343â†’                        break
   344â†’                    fi
   345â†’                done
   346â†’                
   347â†’                # If we still don't have enough content, use what we have
   348â†’                if [[ -z "$aggregated_text" ]]; then
   349â†’                    aggregated_text="${paragraph_array[-1]}"  # Last paragraph
   350â†’                    echo "Fallback: using last paragraph only" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   351â†’                fi
   352â†’                
   353â†’                # Prepend user prompt if available using DRY function
   354â†’                if [[ -n "$user_prompt" ]]; then
   355â†’                    final_sentence=$(create_user_prefixed_content "$clean_user_prompt" "$aggregated_text")
   356â†’                else
   357â†’                    final_sentence="$aggregated_text"
   358â†’                fi
   359â†’                
   360â†’                final_length=${#final_sentence}
   361â†’                final_seconds=$(echo "$final_length / $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.1f", $0}')
   362â†’                echo "Final aggregation: $paragraph_count paragraph(s), ${final_length} chars, ${final_seconds}s" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   363â†’            fi
   364â†’        fi
   365â†’        
   366â†’        echo "Final text for TTS (${#final_sentence} chars): ${final_sentence:0:100}..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   367â†’        
   368â†’        # === CLIPBOARD DEBUGGING FEATURE ===
   369â†’        # Copy TTS content to clipboard for user examination
   370â†’        # Enable with: export CLAUDE_TTS_TO_CLIPBOARD=1
   371â†’        echo "$(date): Checking clipboard debug flag: CLAUDE_TTS_TO_CLIPBOARD='${CLAUDE_TTS_TO_CLIPBOARD:-UNSET}'" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   372â†’        if [[ "${CLAUDE_TTS_TO_CLIPBOARD:-0}" == "1" ]]; then
   373â†’            # Create comprehensive clipboard content with metadata
   374â†’            clipboard_content="=== Claude TTS Content Debug $(date) ===
   375â†’Session: $session_id
   376â†’Length: ${#final_sentence} chars
   377â†’Estimated Duration: $(echo "${#final_sentence} / $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.1f", $0}')s
   378â†’Speech Rate: ${SPEECH_RATE} WPM
   379â†’
   380â†’=== ORIGINAL TEXT ===
   381â†’$final_sentence
   382â†’
   383â†’=== SANITIZED TEXT (what actually gets spoken) ===
   384â†’[Will be shown after sanitization]
   385â†’
   386â†’=== END DEBUG INFO ===
   387â†’"
   388â†’            
   389â†’            # Copy to clipboard with error handling
   390â†’            if echo "$clipboard_content" | pbcopy 2>/dev/null; then
   391â†’                echo "$(date): TTS content copied to clipboard for debugging" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   392â†’            else
   393â†’                echo "$(date): Failed to copy TTS content to clipboard" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   394â†’            fi
   395â†’            
   396â†’            # Also save to persistent debug file for examination
   397â†’            debug_file="/tmp/claude_tts_content_$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S).txt"
   398â†’            echo "$clipboard_content" > "$debug_file" 2>/dev/null && \
   399â†’                echo "$(date): TTS content saved to $debug_file" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   400â†’        fi
   401â†’        
   402â†’        # Speak the final sentence using configured speech rate
   403â†’        if [[ -n "$final_sentence" && ${#final_sentence} -gt 3 ]]; then
   404â†’            # BULLETPROOF TTS Sanitization (Multi-Layer Defense)
   405â†’            sanitized_text="$final_sentence"
   406â†’            
   407â†’            # Layer 1: Basic character normalization
   408â†’            sanitized_text=$(echo "$sanitized_text" | sed 's/[""''`]/'"'"'/g')  # Replace all quote types with single quotes
   409â†’            sanitized_text=$(echo "$sanitized_text" | sed 's/[â€”â€“â€”]/â€”/g')  # Normalize em-dashes
   410â†’            sanitized_text=$(echo "$sanitized_text" | sed 's/[âœ…âŒðŸ”ðŸŽ¯ðŸ”§ðŸ“âš¡ðŸŽ‰]//g')  # Remove common emojis
   411â†’            sanitized_text=$(echo "$sanitized_text" | sed 's/\*\*\?//g')  # Remove markdown stars
   412â†’            sanitized_text=$(echo "$sanitized_text" | sed 's/##\?//g')  # Remove markdown headers
   413â†’            sanitized_text=$(echo "$sanitized_text" | tr '\n\r' ' ')  # Convert line breaks to spaces
   414â†’            
   415â†’            # Layer 2: Fix leading dash problem (critical fix)
   416â†’            sanitized_text=$(echo "$sanitized_text" | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*-/The/')  # Replace leading dash with "The"
   417â†’            sanitized_text=$(echo "$sanitized_text" | sed 's/\.\.\. -/. The/g')  # Replace "... -" with ". The"
   418â†’            
   419â†’            # Layer 3: Advanced shell-safe cleaning
   420â†’            sanitized_text=$(echo "$sanitized_text" | sed 's/  \+/ /g')  # Collapse multiple spaces
   421â†’            sanitized_text=$(echo "$sanitized_text" | sed 's/^ *//; s/ *$//')  # Trim whitespace
   422â†’            sanitized_text=$(echo "$sanitized_text" | tr -d '\0-\31\127')  # Remove control characters
   423â†’            
   424â†’            # Layer 4: Final validation and fallback
   425â†’            if [[ ${#sanitized_text} -lt 3 ]]; then
   426â†’                sanitized_text="Claude response complete"
   427â†’                echo "Sanitization resulted in too-short text, using fallback" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   428â†’            fi
   429â†’            
   430â†’            # === UPDATE CLIPBOARD WITH SANITIZED TEXT ===
   431â†’            if [[ "${CLAUDE_TTS_TO_CLIPBOARD:-0}" == "1" ]]; then
   432â†’                # Update clipboard with both original and sanitized versions
   433â†’                updated_clipboard_content="=== Claude TTS Content Debug $(date) ===
   434â†’Session: $session_id
   435â†’Length: ${#final_sentence} chars (original) â†’ ${#sanitized_text} chars (sanitized)
   436â†’Estimated Duration: $(echo "${#sanitized_text} / $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.1f", $0}')s
   437â†’Speech Rate: ${SPEECH_RATE} WPM
   438â†’
   439â†’=== ORIGINAL TEXT ===
   440â†’$final_sentence
   441â†’
   442â†’=== SANITIZED TEXT (what actually gets spoken) ===
   443â†’$sanitized_text
   444â†’
   445â†’=== SANITIZATION CHANGES ===
   446â†’Original length: ${#final_sentence} chars
   447â†’Sanitized length: ${#sanitized_text} chars
   448â†’Character difference: $((${#final_sentence} - ${#sanitized_text}))
   449â†’
   450â†’=== END DEBUG INFO ===
   451â†’"
   452â†’                
   453â†’                # Update clipboard and debug file with complete info
   454â†’                if echo "$updated_clipboard_content" | pbcopy 2>/dev/null; then
   455â†’                    echo "$(date): Updated clipboard with sanitized TTS content" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   456â†’                fi
   457â†’                
   458â†’                # Update the debug file with complete content
   459â†’                debug_file="/tmp/claude_tts_content_$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S).txt"
   460â†’                echo "$updated_clipboard_content" > "$debug_file" 2>/dev/null && \
   461â†’                    echo "$(date): Updated debug file with sanitized content: $debug_file" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   462â†’            fi
   463â†’            
   464â†’            # Layer 5: Safe file-based execution with robust error handling
   465â†’            temp_speech_file=""
   466â†’            cleanup_temp_file() {
   467â†’                if [[ -n "$temp_speech_file" && -f "$temp_speech_file" ]]; then
   468â†’                    rm -f "$temp_speech_file" 2>/dev/null
   469â†’                    echo "$(date): Cleaned up temp file: $temp_speech_file" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   470â†’                fi
   471â†’            }
   472â†’            
   473â†’            # Set cleanup trap for any exit scenario
   474â†’            trap cleanup_temp_file EXIT INT TERM
   475â†’            
   476â†’            # Create temp file with proper randomization (no .txt suffix for mktemp)
   477â†’            if temp_speech_file=$(mktemp /tmp/claude_speech_XXXXXX 2>/dev/null); then
   478â†’                echo "$(date): Created temp file: $temp_speech_file" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   479â†’                
   480â†’                # Write sanitized text to temp file with error checking
   481â†’                if echo "$sanitized_text" > "$temp_speech_file" 2>/dev/null; then
   482â†’                    echo "Original text length: ${#final_sentence}, Sanitized length: ${#sanitized_text}" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   483â†’                    echo "First 100 chars of sanitized text: ${sanitized_text:0:100}" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   484â†’                    echo "Using temp file for TTS: $temp_speech_file" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   485â†’                    
   486â†’                    # Add a small delay to let notification sound finish
   487â†’                    sleep 0.5
   488â†’                    
   489â†’                    # Execute TTS with file input (completely avoids shell escaping issues)
   490â†’                    say_output=$(say -r "$SPEECH_RATE" -f "$temp_speech_file" 2>&1)
   491â†’                    say_exit_code=$?
   492â†’                else
   493â†’                    echo "$(date): Failed to write to temp file, falling back to direct TTS" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   494â†’                    say_output=$(echo "$sanitized_text" | say -r "$SPEECH_RATE" -f - 2>&1)
   495â†’                    say_exit_code=$?
   496â†’                fi
   497â†’            else
   498â†’                echo "$(date): mktemp failed, using fallback approach" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   499â†’                # Fallback: use stdin pipe method
   500â†’                say_output=$(echo "$sanitized_text" | say -r "$SPEECH_RATE" -f - 2>&1)
   501â†’                say_exit_code=$?
   502â†’            fi
   503â†’            
   504â†’            # Manual cleanup (trap will also ensure cleanup)
   505â†’            cleanup_temp_file
   506â†’            
   507â†’            echo "TTS exit code: $say_exit_code" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   508â†’            if [[ $say_exit_code -ne 0 ]]; then
   509â†’                echo "TTS error output: $say_output" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   510â†’                # Ultimate fallback
   511â†’                echo "TTS failed, executing fallback notification" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   512â†’                say -r "$SPEECH_RATE" "Claude response ready" 2>/dev/null || true
   513â†’            else
   514â†’                echo "TTS executed successfully at ${SPEECH_RATE} WPM using file input" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   515â†’            fi
   516â†’        else
   517â†’            nohup say -r "$SPEECH_RATE" "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
   518â†’            echo "Fallback TTS executed - final sentence too short" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   519â†’        fi
   520â†’    else
   521â†’        # Fallback message
   522â†’        nohup say -r "$SPEECH_RATE" "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
   523â†’        echo "Fallback TTS executed - no response found after delay" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   524â†’    fi
   525â†’else
   526â†’    # Fallback if no transcript available
   527â†’    nohup say -r "$SPEECH_RATE" "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
   528â†’    echo "Fallback TTS executed - no transcript available" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
   529â†’fi

#!/bin/bash

# Enhanced TTS script - Intelligently speaks Claude responses with paragraph aggregation
#
# KNOWN LIMITATION: Interactive plan approval dialogs do NOT trigger any hook events
# - Plan presentation works (triggers Stop hook)
# - Normal responses work (triggers Stop hook) 
# - Interactive prompts ("Would you like to proceed? 1/2/3") bypass hook system entirely
# - This is a confirmed Claude Code limitation (GitHub issues #1460, #2223)
# - No UserPromptSubmit, Notification, or other hooks fire during interactive prompts
# - Users must rely on manual TTS commands for interactive prompt feedback
#
# Configurable TTS parameters
SPEECH_RATE=198                    # Words per minute (10% slower than 220)
CHARS_PER_SECOND=16.50            # Estimated characters per second (198 WPM / 60 * 5 chars/word)
MAX_FULL_RESPONSE_SECONDS=10      # If entire response â‰¤ this, read it all
MIN_PARAGRAPH_CHARS=50            # Minimum characters for a paragraph to be considered adequate
TARGET_MIN_SECONDS=5              # Target minimum speech duration 
TARGET_MAX_SECONDS=25             # Target maximum speech duration before stopping aggregation
TARGET_MIN_CHARS=$(echo "$TARGET_MIN_SECONDS * $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.0f", $0}')
TARGET_MAX_CHARS=$(echo "$TARGET_MAX_SECONDS * $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.0f", $0}')
# Rotate log if it gets too large (>50KB)
if [[ -f /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log ]] && [[ $(stat -f%z /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log 2>/dev/null || echo 0) -gt 51200 ]]; then
    mv /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log.old
fi
echo "$(date): Enhanced TTS hook triggered" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
echo "$(date): Glass sound should have played before this entry" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log

# Read JSON input from stdin
input=$(cat)
echo "Input received: $input" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log

# Extract all available fields from JSON input for debugging
session_id=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.session_id // empty')
transcript_path=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.transcript_path // empty')
hook_event_name=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.hook_event_name // empty')
stop_hook_active=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.stop_hook_active // empty')
cwd=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.cwd // empty')

echo "=== HOOK EVENT DETAILS ===" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
echo "Session ID: $session_id" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
echo "Transcript path: $transcript_path" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
echo "Hook event name: $hook_event_name" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
echo "Stop hook active: $stop_hook_active" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
echo "Working directory: $cwd" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
echo "=========================" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log

if [[ -n "$transcript_path" && -f "$transcript_path" ]]; then
    echo "File exists and is readable" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    
    # Wait for transcript to be fully written by polling for a complete entry
    # We'll wait up to 5 seconds, checking every 0.5 seconds
    max_attempts=10
    attempt=0
    last_response=""
    
    while [[ $attempt -lt $max_attempts ]]; do
        # Get the last few lines and look for the most recent assistant response
        last_lines=$(tail -20 "$transcript_path" 2>/dev/null)
        
        # Look for assistant response with our session ID
        temp_response=$(echo "$last_lines" | tail -r | while read -r line; do
            if [[ -n "$line" ]]; then
                # Check if this is an assistant message with matching session
                role=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.role // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                type=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.type // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                line_session=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.sessionId // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                
                if [[ "$role" == "assistant" && "$type" == "assistant" && "$line_session" == "$session_id" ]]; then
                    # Try to extract text content
                    text_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[]? | select(.type == "text") | .text // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                    
                    if [[ -n "$text_content" && ${#text_content} -gt 20 ]]; then
                        echo "$text_content"
                        exit 0
                    fi
                fi
            fi
        done 2>/dev/null)
        
        if [[ -n "$temp_response" && ${#temp_response} -gt 20 ]]; then
            last_response="$temp_response"
            echo "Found complete response on attempt $((attempt + 1)): ${#last_response} chars" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            break
        fi
        
        echo "Attempt $((attempt + 1)): Waiting for complete transcript entry..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        sleep 0.5
        ((attempt++))
    done
    
    if [[ -z "$last_response" ]]; then
        echo "Timeout: Falling back to any available response" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        # Fallback: try to get any recent assistant response
        last_response=$(echo "$last_lines" | tail -r | while read -r line; do
            if [[ -n "$line" ]]; then
                role=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.role // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                type=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.type // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                
                if [[ "$role" == "assistant" && "$type" == "assistant" ]]; then
                    text_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[]? | select(.type == "text") | .text // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                    if [[ -n "$text_content" && ${#text_content} -gt 10 ]]; then
                        echo "$text_content"
                        exit 0
                    fi
                fi
            fi
        done 2>/dev/null)
    fi
    
    # Also look for user prompt with specific pattern
    user_prompt=""
    echo "Searching for user prompt with specific pattern..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    
    # Look for the most recent user message in this session
    echo "Searching for user message in session: $session_id" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    echo "Available lines to search: $(echo "$last_lines" | wc -l)" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    
    user_content=$(echo "$last_lines" | tail -r | while read -r line; do
        if [[ -n "$line" ]]; then
            role=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.role // empty' 2>/dev/null)
            type=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.type // empty' 2>/dev/null)
            line_session=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.sessionId // empty' 2>/dev/null)
            
            echo "Checking line: role=$role, type=$type, session=$line_session" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            
            if [[ "$role" == "user" && "$type" == "user" && "$line_session" == "$session_id" ]]; then
                # Skip tool result messages - look for actual text messages only
                has_tool_result=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[]? | select(.type == "tool_result") | .type // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                
                if [[ -z "$has_tool_result" ]]; then
                    # Try to extract text content from real user messages
                    text_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[]? | select(.type == "text") | .text // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                    
                    # If that fails, try alternative extraction methods
                    if [[ -z "$text_content" ]]; then
                        text_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[0].text // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                    fi
                    
                    # Check if content is a string (not object/array)
                    if [[ -z "$text_content" ]]; then
                        content_type=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content | type' 2>/dev/null)
                        if [[ "$content_type" == "string" ]]; then
                            text_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                        fi
                    fi
                    
                    echo "Found user text message with content: ${text_content:0:50}..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                    
                    if [[ -n "$text_content" && "$text_content" != "null" && ${#text_content} -gt 2 ]]; then
                        echo "$text_content"
                        exit 0
                    fi
                else
                    echo "Skipping tool result message" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                fi
            fi
        fi
    done 2>/dev/null)
    
    # If no exact session match, try any recent user message (SKIP tool results!)
    if [[ -z "$user_content" ]]; then
        echo "No session-specific user message found, trying any recent user message" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        user_content=$(echo "$last_lines" | tail -r | while read -r line; do
            if [[ -n "$line" ]]; then
                role=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.role // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                type=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.type // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                
                if [[ "$role" == "user" && "$type" == "user" ]]; then
                    # CRITICAL: Skip tool result messages completely in fallback too!
                    has_tool_result=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[]? | select(.type == "tool_result") | .type // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                    
                    if [[ -z "$has_tool_result" ]]; then
                        # Try multiple extraction methods for user text content
                        text_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[]? | select(.type == "text") | .text // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                        
                        # If that fails, try alternative extraction methods
                        if [[ -z "$text_content" ]]; then
                            text_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content[0].text // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                        fi
                        
                        # Check if content is a string (not object/array) and not a tool result
                        if [[ -z "$text_content" ]]; then
                            content_type=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content | type' 2>/dev/null)
                            if [[ "$content_type" == "string" ]]; then
                                candidate_content=$(echo "$line" | jq -r '.message.content // empty' 2>/dev/null)
                                # Reject content that looks like tool results (contains tool_use_id)
                                if [[ "$candidate_content" != *"tool_use_id"* ]]; then
                                    text_content="$candidate_content"
                                fi
                            fi
                        fi
                        
                        if [[ -n "$text_content" && "$text_content" != "null" && ${#text_content} -gt 2 && "$text_content" != *"tool_use_id"* ]]; then
                            echo "Found fallback user message: ${text_content:0:50}..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                            echo "$text_content"
                            exit 0
                        else
                            echo "Skipping potential tool result in fallback: ${text_content:0:30}..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                        fi
                    else
                        echo "Skipping tool result message in fallback" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                    fi
                fi
            fi
        done 2>/dev/null)
    fi
    
    # Always use the user prompt if found (no pattern matching)
    if [[ -n "$user_content" ]]; then
        user_prompt="$user_content"
        echo "Found user prompt: ${#user_prompt} chars" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        echo "User prompt first 100 chars: ${user_prompt:0:100}..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    else
        echo "No user prompt found in transcript" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    fi
    
    echo "Final extracted response length: ${#last_response}" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    echo "First 150 chars: ${last_response:0:150}..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    
    if [[ -n "$last_response" && ${#last_response} -gt 10 ]]; then
        # Prepare content for TTS - combine user prompt and assistant response if both exist
        combined_content=""
        
        # Define reusable function for creating user-prefixed content
        create_user_prefixed_content() {
            local user_text="$1"
            local assistant_text="$2"
            echo "Yourhighness the Great, Destroyer of Catastrophically Underwhelming Flesh-Based Social Protocols prompted. $user_text... Claude Code responded as follows. $assistant_text"
        }
        
        if [[ -n "$user_prompt" ]]; then
            # Clean user prompt
            clean_user_prompt=$(echo "$user_prompt" | \
                sed 's/\\n/ /g' | \
                sed 's/\*\*\([^*]*\)\*\*/\1/g' | \
                sed 's/`\([^`]*\)`/\1/g' | \
                sed 's/<[^>]*>//g')
            
            echo "Added user prompt to TTS content: ${#clean_user_prompt} chars" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        fi
        
        # Clean up assistant response markdown
        clean_text=$(echo "$last_response" | \
            sed 's/\\n/ /g' | \
            sed 's/\*\*\([^*]*\)\*\*/\1/g' | \
            sed 's/`\([^`]*\)`/\1/g' | \
            sed 's/<[^>]*>//g')
        
        # Combine user prompt and assistant response using DRY function
        if [[ -n "$user_prompt" ]]; then
            combined_content=$(create_user_prefixed_content "$clean_user_prompt" "$clean_text")
        else
            combined_content="$clean_text"
        fi
        
        echo "Combined content length: ${#combined_content}" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        echo "Using combined content for TTS processing" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        
        # Calculate estimated speech time using combined content
        estimated_seconds=$(echo "${#combined_content} / $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.1f", $0}')
        echo "Estimated speech time: ${estimated_seconds} seconds for ${#combined_content} characters" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        
        # If combined content is short enough, read the entire thing
        if (( $(echo "$estimated_seconds <= $MAX_FULL_RESPONSE_SECONDS" | bc -l) )); then
            final_sentence="$combined_content"
            echo "Reading entire combined content (${estimated_seconds}s â‰¤ 10s)" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        else
            # For longer content, use intelligent paragraph aggregation on the assistant response part only
            echo "Combined content too long (${estimated_seconds}s > ${MAX_FULL_RESPONSE_SECONDS}s), using paragraph aggregation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            
            # Split assistant response text into paragraphs using a more compatible approach
            # First convert escaped newlines to real newlines
            normalized_text=$(echo "$clean_text" | sed 's/\\n/\n/g')
            
            # Split into paragraphs - first try double newlines, then single
            if echo "$normalized_text" | grep -q $'\n\n'; then
                # Split on double newlines and filter non-empty paragraphs
                paragraph_list=$(echo "$normalized_text" | awk 'BEGIN{RS="\n\n"} {gsub(/^[[:space:]]+|[[:space:]]+$/, ""); if(length > 5) print $0}')
                echo "Using double-newline paragraph separation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            else
                # Split on single newlines and filter substantial content
                paragraph_list=$(echo "$normalized_text" | awk 'BEGIN{RS="\n"} {gsub(/^[[:space:]]+|[[:space:]]+$/, ""); if(length > 15) print $0}')
                echo "Using single-newline paragraph separation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            fi
            
            # Convert to array using a simple approach
            paragraph_array=()
            while IFS= read -r line; do
                if [[ -n "$line" ]]; then
                    paragraph_array+=("$line")
                fi
            done <<< "$paragraph_list"
            
            echo "Found ${#paragraph_array[@]} paragraphs" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            
            if [[ ${#paragraph_array[@]} -eq 0 ]]; then
                # Fallback if no paragraphs found
                fallback_text=$(echo "$clean_text" | tail -c 150 | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*//')
                if [[ -n "$user_prompt" ]]; then
                    final_sentence=$(create_user_prefixed_content "$clean_user_prompt" "$fallback_text")
                else
                    final_sentence="$fallback_text"
                fi
                echo "No paragraphs found, using last 150 characters with user prompt if available" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            else
                # Start with the last paragraph and work backwards
                aggregated_text=""
                paragraph_count=0
                
                # Work backwards through paragraphs
                for (( i=${#paragraph_array[@]}-1; i>=0; i-- )); do
                    # Get current paragraph content
                    current_paragraph="${paragraph_array[i]}"
                    
                    # Try adding this paragraph to our aggregated text with pause markers
                    if [[ -z "$aggregated_text" ]]; then
                        potential_text="$current_paragraph"
                    else
                        # Add paragraph break with pause marker for TTS
                        potential_text="$current_paragraph... $aggregated_text"
                    fi
                    
                    potential_length=${#potential_text}
                    potential_seconds=$(echo "$potential_length / $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l)
                    
                    echo "Considering paragraph $((i+1)): ${#current_paragraph} chars, total would be ${potential_length} chars (${potential_seconds}s)" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                    
                    # If adding this paragraph would exceed our target max, stop (unless we have nothing yet)
                    if [[ -n "$aggregated_text" ]] && (( $(echo "$potential_length > $TARGET_MAX_CHARS" | bc -l) )); then
                        echo "Adding paragraph would exceed target max (${TARGET_MAX_CHARS} chars), stopping aggregation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                        break
                    fi
                    
                    # Add this paragraph
                    aggregated_text="$potential_text"
                    ((paragraph_count++))
                    
                    # Only stop if we've reached close to the maximum target (95% threshold)
                    # Keep aggregating to provide comprehensive content coverage
                    if (( potential_length >= TARGET_MIN_CHARS )) && (( potential_length >= (TARGET_MAX_CHARS * 95 / 100) )); then
                        echo "Reached comprehensive content (${potential_length} chars â‰¥ 95% of target max), stopping aggregation" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                        break
                    fi
                done
                
                # If we still don't have enough content, use what we have
                if [[ -z "$aggregated_text" ]]; then
                    aggregated_text="${paragraph_array[-1]}"  # Last paragraph
                    echo "Fallback: using last paragraph only" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                fi
                
                # Prepend user prompt if available using DRY function
                if [[ -n "$user_prompt" ]]; then
                    final_sentence=$(create_user_prefixed_content "$clean_user_prompt" "$aggregated_text")
                else
                    final_sentence="$aggregated_text"
                fi
                
                final_length=${#final_sentence}
                final_seconds=$(echo "$final_length / $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.1f", $0}')
                echo "Final aggregation: $paragraph_count paragraph(s), ${final_length} chars, ${final_seconds}s" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            fi
        fi
        
        echo "Final text for TTS (${#final_sentence} chars): ${final_sentence:0:100}..." >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        
        # === CLIPBOARD DEBUGGING FEATURE ===
        # Copy TTS content to clipboard for user examination
        # Enable with: export CLAUDE_TTS_TO_CLIPBOARD=1
        echo "$(date): Checking clipboard debug flag: CLAUDE_TTS_TO_CLIPBOARD='${CLAUDE_TTS_TO_CLIPBOARD:-UNSET}'" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        if [[ "${CLAUDE_TTS_TO_CLIPBOARD:-0}" == "1" ]]; then
            # Create comprehensive clipboard content with metadata
            clipboard_content="=== Claude TTS Content Debug $(date) ===
Session: $session_id
Length: ${#final_sentence} chars
Estimated Duration: $(echo "${#final_sentence} / $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.1f", $0}')s
Speech Rate: ${SPEECH_RATE} WPM

=== ORIGINAL TEXT ===
$final_sentence

=== SANITIZED TEXT (what actually gets spoken) ===
[Will be shown after sanitization]

=== END DEBUG INFO ===
"
            
            # Copy to clipboard with error handling
            if echo "$clipboard_content" | pbcopy 2>/dev/null; then
                echo "$(date): TTS content copied to clipboard for debugging" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            else
                echo "$(date): Failed to copy TTS content to clipboard" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            fi
            
            # Also save to persistent debug file for examination
            debug_file="/tmp/claude_tts_content_$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S).txt"
            echo "$clipboard_content" > "$debug_file" 2>/dev/null && \
                echo "$(date): TTS content saved to $debug_file" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        fi
        
        # Speak the final sentence using configured speech rate
        if [[ -n "$final_sentence" && ${#final_sentence} -gt 3 ]]; then
            # BULLETPROOF TTS Sanitization (Multi-Layer Defense)
            sanitized_text="$final_sentence"
            
            # Layer 1: Basic character normalization
            sanitized_text=$(echo "$sanitized_text" | sed 's/[""''`]/'"'"'/g')  # Replace all quote types with single quotes
            sanitized_text=$(echo "$sanitized_text" | sed 's/[â€”â€“â€”]/â€”/g')  # Normalize em-dashes
            sanitized_text=$(echo "$sanitized_text" | sed 's/[âœ…âŒðŸ”ðŸŽ¯ðŸ”§ðŸ“âš¡ðŸŽ‰]//g')  # Remove common emojis
            sanitized_text=$(echo "$sanitized_text" | sed 's/\*\*\?//g')  # Remove markdown stars
            sanitized_text=$(echo "$sanitized_text" | sed 's/##\?//g')  # Remove markdown headers
            sanitized_text=$(echo "$sanitized_text" | tr '\n\r' ' ')  # Convert line breaks to spaces
            
            # Layer 2: Fix leading dash problem (critical fix)
            sanitized_text=$(echo "$sanitized_text" | sed 's/^[[:space:]]*-/The/')  # Replace leading dash with "The"
            sanitized_text=$(echo "$sanitized_text" | sed 's/\.\.\. -/. The/g')  # Replace "... -" with ". The"
            
            # Layer 3: Advanced shell-safe cleaning
            sanitized_text=$(echo "$sanitized_text" | sed 's/  \+/ /g')  # Collapse multiple spaces
            sanitized_text=$(echo "$sanitized_text" | sed 's/^ *//; s/ *$//')  # Trim whitespace
            sanitized_text=$(echo "$sanitized_text" | tr -d '\0-\31\127')  # Remove control characters
            
            # Layer 4: Final validation and fallback
            if [[ ${#sanitized_text} -lt 3 ]]; then
                sanitized_text="Claude response complete"
                echo "Sanitization resulted in too-short text, using fallback" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            fi
            
            # === UPDATE CLIPBOARD WITH SANITIZED TEXT ===
            if [[ "${CLAUDE_TTS_TO_CLIPBOARD:-0}" == "1" ]]; then
                # Update clipboard with both original and sanitized versions
                updated_clipboard_content="=== Claude TTS Content Debug $(date) ===
Session: $session_id
Length: ${#final_sentence} chars (original) â†’ ${#sanitized_text} chars (sanitized)
Estimated Duration: $(echo "${#sanitized_text} / $CHARS_PER_SECOND" | bc -l | awk '{printf "%.1f", $0}')s
Speech Rate: ${SPEECH_RATE} WPM

=== ORIGINAL TEXT ===
$final_sentence

=== SANITIZED TEXT (what actually gets spoken) ===
$sanitized_text

=== SANITIZATION CHANGES ===
Original length: ${#final_sentence} chars
Sanitized length: ${#sanitized_text} chars
Character difference: $((${#final_sentence} - ${#sanitized_text}))

=== END DEBUG INFO ===
"
                
                # Update clipboard and debug file with complete info
                if echo "$updated_clipboard_content" | pbcopy 2>/dev/null; then
                    echo "$(date): Updated clipboard with sanitized TTS content" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                fi
                
                # Update the debug file with complete content
                debug_file="/tmp/claude_tts_content_$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S).txt"
                echo "$updated_clipboard_content" > "$debug_file" 2>/dev/null && \
                    echo "$(date): Updated debug file with sanitized content: $debug_file" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            fi
            
            # Layer 5: Safe file-based execution with robust error handling
            temp_speech_file=""
            cleanup_temp_file() {
                if [[ -n "$temp_speech_file" && -f "$temp_speech_file" ]]; then
                    rm -f "$temp_speech_file" 2>/dev/null
                    echo "$(date): Cleaned up temp file: $temp_speech_file" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                fi
            }
            
            # Set cleanup trap for any exit scenario
            trap cleanup_temp_file EXIT INT TERM
            
            # Create temp file with proper randomization (no .txt suffix for mktemp)
            if temp_speech_file=$(mktemp /tmp/claude_speech_XXXXXX 2>/dev/null); then
                echo "$(date): Created temp file: $temp_speech_file" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                
                # Write sanitized text to temp file with error checking
                if echo "$sanitized_text" > "$temp_speech_file" 2>/dev/null; then
                    echo "Original text length: ${#final_sentence}, Sanitized length: ${#sanitized_text}" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                    echo "First 100 chars of sanitized text: ${sanitized_text:0:100}" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                    echo "Using temp file for TTS: $temp_speech_file" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                    
                    # Add a small delay to let notification sound finish
                    sleep 0.5
                    
                    # Execute TTS with file input (completely avoids shell escaping issues)
                    say_output=$(say -r "$SPEECH_RATE" -f "$temp_speech_file" 2>&1)
                    say_exit_code=$?
                else
                    echo "$(date): Failed to write to temp file, falling back to direct TTS" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                    say_output=$(echo "$sanitized_text" | say -r "$SPEECH_RATE" -f - 2>&1)
                    say_exit_code=$?
                fi
            else
                echo "$(date): mktemp failed, using fallback approach" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                # Fallback: use stdin pipe method
                say_output=$(echo "$sanitized_text" | say -r "$SPEECH_RATE" -f - 2>&1)
                say_exit_code=$?
            fi
            
            # Manual cleanup (trap will also ensure cleanup)
            cleanup_temp_file
            
            echo "TTS exit code: $say_exit_code" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            if [[ $say_exit_code -ne 0 ]]; then
                echo "TTS error output: $say_output" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                # Ultimate fallback
                echo "TTS failed, executing fallback notification" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
                say -r "$SPEECH_RATE" "Claude response ready" 2>/dev/null || true
            else
                echo "TTS executed successfully at ${SPEECH_RATE} WPM using file input" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
            fi
        else
            nohup say -r "$SPEECH_RATE" "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
            echo "Fallback TTS executed - final sentence too short" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
        fi
    else
        # Fallback message
        nohup say -r "$SPEECH_RATE" "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
        echo "Fallback TTS executed - no response found after delay" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
    fi
else
    # Fallback if no transcript available
    nohup say -r "$SPEECH_RATE" "Claude response complete" > /dev/null 2>&1 &
    echo "Fallback TTS executed - no transcript available" >> /tmp/claude_tts_debug.log
fi

```bash
cat | /Users/terryli/.claude/claude_response_speaker.sh &
```

This command structure doesn't work as expected because the `&` applies to the entire pipeline. When you use `cat | command &`, the stdin from the hook (containing the JSON data) gets lost because the backgrounded process can't properly receive it.

content.text:
The fix works by:

1. **Wrapping in braces `{}`** - This groups the pipeline as a single command unit
2. **Redirecting output `> /dev/null 2>&1`** - Prevents any output from interfering with Claude Code
3. **Background execution `&`** - Now properly backgrounds the entire grouped command

This ensures the JSON input from stdin gets passed to your TTS script while truly running in the background, allowing Claude Code to complete immediately.
